thread.title: Jimmy Neesham celebrates his easiest victory ever
thread.title_full: Jimmy Neesham celebrates his easiest victory ever

title: Jimmy Neesham celebrates his easiest victory ever
text:
Jimmy Neesham celebrates his easiest victory ever Last updated 11:49, February 6 2017 PHOTOSPORT 
Jimmy Neesham scored just one run against Australia on Sunday. 
Black Caps all-rounder Jimmy Neesham might not have contributed much on the field during the side's Chappell-Hadlee win in Hamilton on Sunday, but it doesn't look as though he's too bothered. 
Neesham scored one run from seven balls before playing onto his stumps to the bowling if Josh Hazelwood in New Zealand's innings of 281, and followed it up with 0-17 from three overs with ball in hand as the Black Caps bowled out Australia for 257 to claim a 24-run win. 
The all-rounder took to Facebook to share a candid picture of himself and paceman Lockie Ferguson with the trophy after the match, captioned "When you don't do any work on the group project but still get an A." 
Ferguson went 0-62 and was bowled first ball on Sunday.
